00039 #define MAXLOCKDESCLENGTH 40 
00040 typedef struct
00041 {
00042       UINT8       ubEditorName[ MAXLOCKDESCLENGTH ];  // name to display in editor

00050 // Defines below for the perceived value of the door
00051 #define DOOR_PERCEIVED_UNKNOWN            0
00052 #define DOOR_PERCEIVED_LOCKED             1
00053 #define DOOR_PERCEIVED_UNLOCKED           2
00054 #define DOOR_PERCEIVED_BROKEN             3
00055 
00056 #define DOOR_PERCEIVED_TRAPPED            1
00057 #define DOOR_PERCEIVED_UNTRAPPED    2
00058 
00059 typedef struct
00060 {
00061       INT16             sGridNo;
00062       BOOLEAN           fLocked;                                        // is the door locked
00063       UINT8             ubTrapLevel;                              // difficulty of finding the trap, 0-10
00064       UINT8             ubTrapID;                                       // the trap type (0 is no trap)
00065       UINT8             ubLockID;                                       // the lock (0 is no lock)
00066       INT8              bPerceivedLocked;             // The perceived lock value can be different than the fLocked.
00067                                                                                                       // Values for this include the fact that we don't know the status of
00068                                                                                                       // the door, etc
00069       INT8              bPerceivedTrapped;            // See above, but with respect to traps rather than locked status
00070       INT8              bLockDamage;                              // Damage to the lock
00071       INT8              bPadding[4];                              // extra bytes
00072 } DOOR;
00073

00139 /**********************************
00140  * Door utils add by Kris Morness *
00141  **********************************/
00142 
00143 //Dynamic array of Doors.  For general game purposes, the doors that are locked and/or trapped
00144 //are permanently saved within the map, and are loaded and allocated when the map is loaded.  Because
00145 //the editor allows more doors to be added, or removed, the actual size of the DoorTable may change.
00146 extern DOOR *DoorTable;
00147 
00148 //Current number of doors in world.
00149 extern UINT8 gubNumDoors;
00150 //Current max number of doors.  This is only used by the editor.  When adding doors to the 
00151 //world, we may run out of space in the DoorTable, so we will allocate a new array with extra slots,
00152 //then copy everything over again.  gubMaxDoors holds the arrays actual number of slots, even though
00153 //the current number (gubNumDoors) will be <= to it.
00154 extern UINT8 gubMaxDoors;
00155 //File I/O for loading the door information from the map.  This automatically allocates
00156 //the exact number of slots when loading.
00157 
00158 extern void LoadDoorTableFromMap( INT8 **hBuffer );
00159 //Saves the existing door information to the map.  Before it actually saves, it'll verify that the
00160 //door still exists.  Otherwise, it'll ignore it.  It is possible in the editor to delete doors in 
00161 //many different ways, so I opted to put it in the saving routine.
00162 extern void SaveDoorTableToMap( HWFILE fp );
00163 //The editor adds locks to the world.  If the gridno already exists, then the currently existing door
00164 //information is overwritten.
00165 extern void AddDoorInfoToTable( DOOR *pDoor );
00166 //When the editor removes a door from the world, this function looks for and removes accompanying door
00167 //information.  If the entry is not the last entry, the last entry is move to it's current slot, to keep
00168 //everything contiguous.
00169 extern void RemoveDoorInfoFromTable( INT32 iMapIndex );
00170 //This is the link to see if a door exists at a gridno.  
00171 DOOR * FindDoorInfoAtGridNo( INT32 iMapIndex );
00172 //Upon world deallocation, the door table needs to be deallocated.
00173 extern void TrashDoorTable();
